thread.title: Chelsea encounter problem over midfielder transfer
thread.title_full: Chelsea encounter problem over midfielder transfer

title: Chelsea encounter problem over midfielder transfer
text:
Chelsea encounter problem over midfielder transfer CHELSEA’s hopes of signing Claudio Marchisio are under threat, according to reports in Italy. PUBLISHED: 13:00, Fri, Feb 17, 2017 | UPDATED: 13:09, Fri, Feb 17, 2017 
Chelsea are said to be eyeing Marchisio and are frontrunners in the betting markets to secure a deal for the Italian. 
Manager Antonio Conte is said to be a fan of the midfielder, who played under the boss when he was in charge of the Italian national team and during his time at Juventus. Chelsea predicted team to face Wolves in FA Cup Thu, February 16, 2017 Express Sport brings you Chelsea's predicted team to face Wolves in the FA Cup Fifth round this weekend Chelsea   12 Who could Antonio Conte start against Wolves in the FA Cup? 
talkSPORT even claimed this week that is on Conte’s summer shopping list. 
Conte was given over £120million to spend on new players last summer, while the Blues have already raised funds for next term with the £60m sale of Oscar to the Chinese Super League. 
But reports in Italy claim a deal for the Juventus star may be harder than first thought. GETTY Juventus supposedly sees Claudio Marchisio as unsellable GETTY Antonio Conte (right) has managed Marchisio at Juve and Italy GETTY Marchisio has been at Juventus all his career 
According to Gazzetta Mercato - a sister outlet of Italian newspaper Gazzetta dello Sport - Juventus consider Marchisio unsellable. 
The 31-year-old, who has been at Juve all his career bar a loan spell at Empoli in 2007, has played just 14 games for Juve all season after missing the start of the campaign through injury. Related articles
